place_description: Your neighborhood headquarters offering coffee & smoothies, breakfast, burgers & deli, pizza, pastries, and full bar.

reviews_data.review_text: I ordered through DoorDash for 13 food items. There was no option to include additional instruction. So I literally made a phone call to let them know to write the food name on the box label. When I arrived, it was ready and none of the label was written. I asked the guy to write it, and he was super mad and upset. Then he went and wrote it for me. I reached home and not a single side was included such as potato chips and other sides that was all selected. Not only that couple of items were missing as well. Fruit juice and ice tea was a separate order, which was not in the package. I will not recommend this for Doordash order. Included pics and videos of indoor and also the guy who was upset.

The People's Market offers a warm, inviting atmosphere paired with a nice selection of food and drinks. It's a great place for a casual breakfast or lunch and convenient for pickup orders. It's also a go-to spot to work remote.

Great atmosphere for a bit and some casual drink. Got the chicken sandwich and side salad. Salad was great with homemade ranch and the chicken sandwich one of the best I've had in Charlotte. Would highly recommend checking this place out!

I was on my way to church and my wife needed some sustenance ASAP! The Peoples Market has some of the freshest smoothies in CLT so we forced a stop.  My ordered her smoothie and a ham and cheese croissant and it was everything she needed.

You can taste the quality of the ingredients.  I called to place an order over the phone, and they don't take phone orders, but they had the smoothie ready as soon as we got there.

The servers were friendly and personable, I will definitely be back.
I have been here only for coffee, but it has been delicious each time.

Love this spot, my go to for coffee, breakfast and lunch!! Such a vibe, food is amazing (market bagel and salmon blt are my faves), owner and staff are great plus parking!! a lovely place to post up and work remotely too  thanks for all you guys do!

Food is tasty, but the value is not there. Portions are small and service meh. I ordered for pick up, but they don't tell you when your order is ready. I called to check, but they just said the time frame that it should be ready in but couldn't confirm if my order was ready. If it had been super busy, I get it, but it was 10:45a, not traditional busy time.
Fantastic space. A benefit to the community as well.

It was my first time at the People's Market. This unique market is steps away from Novant/Presbyterian Main and CPCC's main campus. loved the whole vibe here. Reminded me of my college days. Great spot to catch up with friends over breakfast or lunch. Nice healthy menu! Fun atmosphere and a nice variety of wines and beers!
I had the tasty soft breakfast tacos and a delicious mint tea. Hubby had a breakfast Burrito that did not disappoint along with his coffee. Our daughter had toast, eggs and  bacon, and a nice warm tea!  We will make this one of our "go-to spots" on our list where to take family and friends when they come to visit us in the Queen City!
Delicious vegan breakfast burrito.
Love the vibes here. Great place to grad some coffee and work
Excellent Vegan donuts!
We have a monthly meeting here. Great atmosphere and food.
Loved everything I got - chicken avocado wrap, sweet potato fries, honey bee latte, and a croissant! Cute atmosphere with lots of seating.

I discovered this special cafe one day after a doctor's appointment. The entire Elizabeth neighborhood is very cool with lots of restaurants and bars as well as trolley service that runs throughout.

I had the ham and cheese croissant and it was excellent! Whatever cheese they use in that thing is special. I also had a peach blossom iced tea with elderberry syrup and I was tempted to get a second.

The bakery is on the left. The bar is in the center, and the order and pick up window for savory foods is on the right. You can order food while sitting at the bar as well.

I really enjoyed the openness of the space as well as all the natural light. The garage doors are probably fun to open in the spring and fall. Since they have a kids menu, I'm excited to bring my whole family back to enjoy it!
One of my favorite coffee shops to get a bite and some excellent coffee.
Breakfast burrito was yummy.

Freaking looooveeeee this place for lunch! Whenever I work in Uptown I've just gotta come here to get their chicken avocado wrap - DELICIOUS EVERY TIME!!!! Vibe is so upbeat and modern, food is made quickly, and it's just a grand ol' time all around. Highly recommend!
A great place to work and have coffee/tea. Baristas are lovely and the food selection is great for a morning work session.

This is set up cafeteria style. You find a table and then go order your food/drinks. There are three food counters. Great variety, for breakfast and lunch. Very clean and plenty of seating. There's also a private room you can rent for meetings. Food is priced great and tastes so good. I had the smash burger and salad. My friend had a BLT. Definitely recommend!
Great prices on breakfast and coffee. If I lived closer, I'd be here every day.
Amazing vibe with good food and coffee.

My favorite cafe/coffee shop in Charlotte! My go to's are the iced Vanilla Lavender latte (Homemade syrups) and any of the danishes, but Pastries are always delicious and nice to see them being made in the bakery area while hanging around. It draws a diverse crowd so always an interesting atmosphere.
The cinnamon roll croissants have me in a chock hold.

The People's Market is such a clutch spot for good coffee, good food and good vibes. I'm a regular here, so I've tried a lot of things on the menu and I've never been disappointed. This is also a good spot for remote workers. I've worked from People's Market several times and have always been able to find a parking spot, a comfy seat and a power outlet.

A great spot to read, get some work done, or meet up with friends. There's a lot of space and a wide range of seating options suitable for groups small and large. The food is delicious (though a little pricey) and the coffee/pastries are delicious. It's a vibrant atmosphere with kind and attentive staff--highly recommend!
Great place to hangout for writing, reading, meeting friends or colleauges or just a coffee - Excellent Lattes.
You'll see many people working in their laptops. Pretty informal and cute.
Sweet potatoes are good ! Fried oyster sandwich was decent, I do think the sandwich was overpriced. As far as the atmosphere it was really clean , but it was FREEZING inside!
A lovely spot in the heart of Elizabeth. The brekkie burrito slaps and the vibe is top tier. Do it.
Delicious food & great service.
Is ok. It is very loud and hard to find seating. The sandwich is small for the price but tasty.
Gluten free maple muffin is delicious.  The croissants are way too dry. Coffee is delicious and staff is amazing.  Avoid cheese danish. Mine was not edible.
Extremely quick service, friendly staff, delicious food and drinks - added to my list of favorite spots! The burger in particular was incredible. Make sure to ask for extra house sauce!!
Don't try to order catering on the website. Management won't get the request and the options are not congruent with what they say they offer.

I was in Charlotte and wanted a place to work where I could grab something to eat and some good coffee.

The setup for ordering and getting your food was a bit different but the cashier explained it when my order was complete.

The menu for breakfast was pretty good and definitely a step above a regular coffee shop.

The only downside was that the coffee only came on one size. And it wasn't very big. But was reasonably priced.

The atmosphere was a mix of people meeting up and working like me. I was able to work until my computer battery got low. I didn't see an outlet so I packed up and went to another coffee shop. But that was really my only gripe. Not worth knocking a star though cause I probably needed to move and make room for others anyway.
Great vibes. Didn't have to turn on headphones to drown out bad music. Perfect  space for WFH folks that want to step out. Can't beat the free parking too

i came in on an afternoon and this tall guy was "helping" me pick out a coffee, and it was a terrible iced latte, the espresso was watery and my drink had no body, there are so many better places for food and coffee in the area. will not be returning.
The perfect welcome to Elizabeth spot! A open space for working and or connecting with loved ones. Truly one of my all time faves in Elizabeth.

Amazing Food and Atmosphere! Love this place although only been once LOL . They got me hooked already! I definitely suggest the Vegan Chicken Sandwich. My Wife said it was the Best she ever had!!! I enjoyed the pastries they had as well. Had a Sea Salt Chocolate Chip Cookie that was Amazing!! Should have gotten more than one when I was there. GO TO THIS PLACE!
Great neighborhood spot. I like that they are open for all meals and have lots of healthy and fun options

As a vegan, The People's Market has been a favorite of mine since they were on East. But now since going gluten-free also,  they are my top choice. It's perfect for a quick breakfast, meeting up with friends, or grabbing a coffee while working from home. I'm grateful for their hearty, fulfilling breakfast options and delicious baked treats. I do not take it for granted. Please don't ever leave me.

Went here on our way out of town for lunch. I eat plant based and went with a gluten free friend and another with no dietary restrictions, so we wanted to try to find somewhere we could all eat.
I had the vegan breakfast burrito which was so good! One friend got a chicken caesar wrap (yay, gluten free wrap!) and the other got a reuben.
We also grabbed some lattes at the coffee counter which were awesome! I had an iced oat milk latte with vanilla and it was perfectly creamy, nutty, and sweet.
This seems like a really nice place to stop in for a bite, a coffee, a snack, or even a bottle of wine to take home. They also have a bar in the middle which seemed to have beer on draft. I also saw plenty of people there to work on laptops and collaborate with others (there is a conference room possibly able to be rented?) so it would be an awesome place to get work done, hang with friends, or grab something to go.
There is also parking for Elizabeth St. shops just across the street!

Loved it! Was stopping by and was pleasantly surprised. Got a cappuccino with lavender vanilla syrup and an everything danish! Coffee wasn't too sweet and was made quickly and orderly, and the danish is soooo yummy and flakey. The lovely woman, Leika, at the counter offered to heat it up for me even though they were busy, so I'm very happy

We stopped by for brunch. It was obviously more for people conducting business, but I still enjoyed visiting. The food was very good, but not really like anything you'd find elsewhere so my very young daughter who is picky wasnt really a fan (she didnt like the smoky syrup like sauce on her oatmeal and berries or the flavors of my bagel). Still, they had free water, beautiful lattes, and large portions. It was busy, but not uncomfortable.

So, I walk in on for a bite to eat on a bright Sunday. This place has been haunting me in Google Maps for several days. I tend to avoid uptown because of parking, but this place was well worth it. I parked on the side street but later saw a parking lot across the street.

I sat at the bar because it was the first thing I really noticed when I walked in. It was mildly busy that day. There were so many smiling faces, and the staff immediately assisted me when I stated it was my first time in.

I ordered the vegan platter (yes, of course, I want the sausage with it) and a lavender vanilla latte with oat milk.

Later, before leaving, I went to the bakery, which is located right inside and to the left and got the donut (vanilla birthday cake) and muffin (chocolate chip). The vegan and gluten-free were on the top shelf and clearly labeled in the case #win

Back to the meal... I ordered and paid at the bar and was told to wait for the text that I would receive when my order was ready. I was directed to the back of the store for the food and the bakery for the coffee, but the bartender grabbed and delivered the items directly to me (so many thanks!)

The food automatically came in to go containers. I appreciated that because it made it easier for me to go from the bar to a table to work (no laptops were allowed at the bar 10a-2p.

I completely enjoyed everything I ate! It was flavored and cooked to perfection 

To say I'll be going back there is an understatement! You'll have to try this place! There are plenty of vegan options, and the price was VERY good for brunch!

Not a full 5 stars because I asked for iced water, and the staff at the bakery counter told me to get the water from the community container. It's awesome that they offer this, but there was no ice.
Also, they had me pay on a device and left the device in front of me for most of my meal. It was awkward and made me feel like I was supposed to do something more.
Great breakfast and lovely service.
Good smash burger
I frequent The People's Market for the food, price, and atmosphere. It has become my go place.

Got all the way home to find the substitute I asked for was not put not on my v bkfast wrap. Tried to call ...& got an answer on an understandably busy Saturday from Meredith who was so kind as to void the transaction & offer a comp item upon my return. Thank you queen! I'll be going back asap for something yummy forsure.
Solid matcha, and the chicken bacon wrap was awesome. Nice lunch option, and I loved that there was space to work/hang. Would love to see some seasonal drink specials though!
Neat place, people were friendly and the burger was juicy and tasty
The baked goods were phenomenal and so was that smash burger. Very chill and peaceful atmosphere. I will definitely be returning.

I had the fried vegan chicken sandwich and it was horrible it was chewy not crispy at all I also had Irish cream coffee which tastes like water down hot chocolate maybe they have something else on the menu that's better but for me to spend 20dollars for those two items and neither one of them was good was a waste of money!!
The baristas are so rude and they do not know how to make anything right! The lattes were so watery.... The egg in the market bagel was also undercooked... will not be returning

The place is nice, the bathrooms are very clean I do have to say. I am very shocked as here in Jersey, that would not be a thing. The customer service is 10/10, the human that made my chai latte really has a craft for making latte art. Also, second best chai latte I've ever had. I cannot really rate the food as I only had an almond croissant, but even the at was very tasty. I will certainly go again! 10/10 I recommend.
Fun place. Great sandwiches. Lots of drink and eat choices. Pizza looked good. I will definitely return.
Chicken wrap was the best ever!!

I used to go to People's Market at its old location and was excited to learn it reopened. Unfortunately that excitement was short lived after I got my breakfast. I ordered a chicken biscuit and the biscuit was inedible. It was dry and fell apart when I cut into it. I have never had dark meat on a biscuit before either and it had a lot of fat.

The sunny side was the chai tea latte.

Chill, open atmosphere, excellent lattes and cocktails, amazing food, and friendly staff. Conveniently located off the lightrail close in Elizabeth and open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Love this place!

I went to have brunch with friends today. I went to the bathroom to find out there was no soap in the restroom, only hand sanitizer. I notified a worker and she said "she was aware and they had no soap only sanitizer in the bathroom". I should have left but I decided to stay and get my order. I am now having a horrible upset  stomach and haven't been able to eat anything since my visit. This unfortunately was my first time visiting the restaurant and maybe my last. I didn't even think about the sanitation of the workers handling the food! Hand sanitizer is NOT soap and does not wash the germs away! I'm disappointed, disgusted, and now sick.

Came for a meeting and got a traditional Iced Coffee with SF Carmel and cream. It was deliciously decadent and smooth. I also got a Sausage Breakfast Burrito with Verde and loved every bite. It was delicious. Ambiance is nice too.
The best place! Great chill but welcoming atmoshphere. The hands-down best Smashburger in town. A great salad (the Hipster is sublime). Great bartenders.
Our first time here, we came for a cocktail class and grabbed some lunch. They were super busy, but service and food was great. We will definitely be back to try other dishes.

I know takeout is a gamble but my entire breakfast bowl is horrible... especially the barely cooked turkey bacon

. Barely toasted English muffin
. almost melted cheese
No effort whatsoever

Great meeting spot to come just chill with a few friends. They also have a private conference room that can be reserved. They have a wide variety of things from pastries to alcohol. This place comes highly recommended.
Great casual place to grab a quick bite or no drink.
The food was great .and the service was great. Will comeback
Some of the best coffee in Charlotte and the food is good too!
A fantastic cafe, great environment, awesome gluten free foods & desserts

I want to start by saying that the coffee staff is amazing and very friendly. They get my drink right every time. With that being sad, the food leaves something to be desired. I get a Market bagel every now and then and for the most part it's usually good. Today however was a very disappointing experience. I spend a lot of money here weekly to be playing roulette with the food hoping that whoever is back there cares enough to put my food together. My market bagel was not toasted, the bacon was not the siracha bacon, the avocado looked like it was just thrown on there and the egg was just plain sad. I come here for the coffee, the staff and pastries. The food needs some work.

Pickup needs to be improved. I should not be expected to know that I need to ask for my order if I ordered online, when all other orders get placed on the counter. I placed an online order and waited past the time that it was done being prepared, because it was sitting behind the counter and my name wasn't called out. Pretty frustrating.
Food & drinks were great

The hidden gem of Elizabeth nestled in a serene location is a perfect weekend workspace. With a tranquil ambiance, it provides a peaceful environment to work, accompanied by exceptional coffee and a well-stocked bar for those seeking a delightful break. A unique spot that combines productivity with relaxation.

The ambience was super amicable and loved the biscuits and the burrito. Location is accessible being very close to the uptown. Staff was very friendly and the market has a very cool vibe to it. With couches and other seating areas, its like a place for all or anytime of the day. Can't wait to be back and try other options on the menu.
Great food, staff is fine, plenty of room to work remotely without feeling like your stealing space from folks

Been here numerous times the food is mediocre their tea is great but the service sometimes is horrible because the workers don't listen when you order your food and it gets scrambled up all over the place at least five times have I got my food wrong. And I'm not the only one I've seen that with other customers. For example if you say no sauce on anything they'll put extra sauce and give you the sauce that they think you like on it.
Great Single patty burger! Ordered ahead and prompt service !
I got the smash burger Jo got the salmon blt.  We were impressed with our food, the local beer selection and the local spirits used in cocktails. Will definitely come back!

This review is overdue. I used Uber Eats for brunch on Sunday, 01-15-23. I ordered the CJ's country boy bowl, creamy grits, mixed fruit, a large jasmine tea, and a regular apple chai-der.

This review is reminding me that I need to stop by to dine in. The bowl was filling by itself. The grits were on point; the food was still hot when delivered. The fruit was fresh. The drinks were hot, too. The jasmine was good, but I could use another apple chai on a cold day like today. I'd only had regular chai up to that point and wanted to try something different. It was very good.

The good reviews helped me decide to try them that day. Hopefully this one will help you decide, too.

Plenty of vegan options. Food was delicious.
Coffee was good.
Ambience was very good. Friendly and helpful staff.
Excellent customer service and food.  Very clean and well maintained.  Wonderful atmosphere, laid back and spacious.
The pizza was really good! We stopped by before going to a show downtown and it was an easy stop with great food.
I'm begging you, add breakfast items to your online ordering  and add your coffees too pls
Great service, friendly staff and warm atmosphere.
The grandkids love the bacon here. That's good because the baked goods are so-so. Wish they were better!
The vegan gingerbread was excellent!

My partner and I came here for lunch and ordered a regular pizza, but asked to make it vegan. The staff person who took our order was very kind and let us know that it would not be a problem which was perfect for me because I am lactose intolerant and have been vegan for 2 years. The pizza came out quickly and it was delicious. Unfortunately, we didn't realize it until we were done eating that the cook in the back put real parmesan cheese on top of the vegan cheese . We saw little white specks on the pizza as we were eating, but we also asked for the balsamic vinaigrette (which we know is vegan) and it has little specks in it so we thought it was that. However, after we completely devoured the pizza we saw dry white specks in the box that were definitely parmesan. I brought it up to John, one of the workers, and he was very responsive, apologetic, and offered to refund us for the pizza. I was okay with that and not super upset because I thought it was just a light sprinkle of cheese but shortly after we left People's Market at 6pm, I got the worst nausea, and I stayed up until 3am with terribleee stomach pain and a lot of mucus buildup. I have never felt that much stomach pain in my life. Apparently, there was way more cheese than we realized.

I love the People's Market so I would go back again but I'm a little scarred and will definitely double check with the order taker to make sure that any non-vegan items are specified to be left out on the ticket.

TLDR: Ordered a vegan pizza and the cook put real cheese on it. Tip for customers - make sure the order ticket specifies to leave non-vegan items off of the food item to be sure.
Much needed spot over in that area.   Wish they would advance and open more locations around the city
Nice place
The food is excellent and customer service is on point. They make you feel like a good friend.
Great variety of shops, all with quality food and drinks. Nice place to meetup or get some work done.
Great place to meet for a working lunch.  Great food too.

I frequent the people's market quite often and I must say this is one of Charlotte's best locations for remote working and small team meetings. The servers are always pleasant and helpful. The food is really great too. Their fries could rival Five Guys! We chose this place because the parking is free and the atmosphere is always on point. We'll definitely be meeting here more often.

Best burger award goes to these folks! Bet!
Challengers accepted! Hard to touch that "I Went Out Last Night Burger"
Delicious food and great remote working atmosphere.

Great place for coffee and pastries. The coffee is really good, and they bake their own pastries on site, and they are excellent. My favorite is the cinnamon roll croissant. On this occasion, I had the pumpkin waffle with brie whipped cream and candied pecans, which was outstanding. So delicious, it was worth the calories spent. It's seasonal, so get it before it's gone.
It's a huge place, so it would be easy for families with kids to be able to find seating and room to spread out. Also a great place if you want to get some work done on your laptop.
It's refreshing to be able to come here on the weekends and not have to wait in a long line and also be sure to get a seat. There is a large free parking lot across the street. It's also on the light rail line. I've been to other nearby coffee shops where there are always issues with long lines, lack of seating, and lack of parking. And I'm not sure if it's worth it at those places.

Came for the cocktail making class once a month (I believe on the 2nd Saturday). It was a lot of fun. Had a coffee and burger while there. The burger was one of the best I've had in a while. Sweet potato fries are also good. Wasn't impressed with the coffee, but I like mine hot, and the girl made it Iced by mistake.  Will try something else next time.

Can a club sandwich be the best sandwich you've potentially ever eaten?

My answer to that before coming here would have been "no chance", but that was before eating it here with the sweet potato waffle fries. One of the best deli meals I've had in a long time and potentially the best I've ever had - and you can check my reviews, I frequent deli's as often as possible.

The atmosphere in here really cool, great vibe with a bar right in the middle. Easy ordering system and super friendly people working here. Not sure what they did to the sandwich, but it was perfect.

Can't recommend this place enough. Now if you'll excuse me, I have an apple cinnamon donut to eat.
Great venue with good food and atmosphere!

LOVE THIS PLACE.
The staff if super welcoming, the food and drink is consistently good, the beer selection is good and it's a chill spot to post up and get some work done.

I don't know what kind of crack they make their iced hazelnut lattes out of but I've yet to find a better coffee place in the city. Foods decent, nothing to write home about if it's not a pastry, but that coffee is so so so good. Staff is great and atmosphere is fantastic.
Such good food and very pleasant staff.  Coffee was good too.
Very pleased! I had the hipster salad with the balsamic vinegarette and it was out of this world! Would 100% recommend for lunch
great cobb salad, kind staff
This place is great. I'll definitely be coming again an again
Such amazing food. Haven't had a dish I don't like. Friendly and helpful staff. It's also a great area to work but can get a bit loud at times.

Informal and cute, I ordered a salmon sandwich, waffle sweet potatoes and a smoothie, everything was so yummy and good price, the service was 2/3 with three people working there, two helpful, friendly and smiling ones, one looked a little that it didn't like its job very much or was tired, I certainly don't know; I will go again maybe to try desserts and coffee (and maybe a sandwich to go hehe), they also looked very good
Great place for a casual breakfast and coffee. They had live music this morning.
I loooove this place. It is a really cute atmosphere, lots of space, and amazing food! Last time I tried their breakfast burrito and it was really good.

The standard American breakfast should always include some form of eggs and grits. The People's Market is a place I've always seen but never knew existed. Their breakfast was so good. Fluffy scrambled eggs. The grits were thick and creamy, and I only needed to add a pinch of pepper. The chicken biscuit is also a great eat. A tender juicy thigh on a fluffy biscuit. I will gladly add The People's Market to my list of breakfast spots. #GratuityAdded

#breakfast  #foodie #instafood  #brunch  #foodblogger #foodstagram #homemade #instagood #thepeoplesmarket #breakfastideas #goodmorning #elizabeth #morning  #breakfasttime #eggs #healthybreakfast #grits

#cltfoodie #fyp   #goodeats #instafood  #foodstagram   #foodblogger #charlottefood   #clteats  #queencity  #charlotteeats  #charlottefoodscene #exploreclt  #eatdrinkclt #cltfoodbloggers
My wife and I were visiting from Richmond, VA. We are both vegetarian, and both thoroughly enjoyed how great the food was, and how QUICK it was ready. Thank you! We will be back soon.

I love the laid back atmosphere that this little market/cafe has. The chicken sandwich is delicious and the coffee is good too. They have an array of baked goods, lunch bites, adult beverages, and snacks available for purchase. My one suggestion would be to combine the coffee shop and food shop ordering stations so that folks can do a single complete transaction instead of doing a separate transaction at each station. Perhaps y'all already have that and I just didn't know.

I order french onion soup.. It looked like my last meal on a ship lost at sea with whatever leftovers they found to scrap together and called it soup... It was terrible taste and appearance. You could have at least made sure the cheese was melted.. Maybe it would have been better.. But the oil looking slug was such a disappointment and a turn off. Thank God they make a killer Chai latte

This is one of my favorite places in Charlotte. I typically go for lunch and each time it has been amazing. From the sandwiches to the pizza to the coffee, everything has been great. They had live music last time I visited which made the experience even better. I can't wait to continue to work my way through the menu!
Please add the kid's chicken tenders to the grown up menu. Hand battered and well seasoned, YUM!

I catered for a staff appreciation party today and was absolutely blown away by the service and the food. I've been to this place many times before today. Big shout out to Justin who helped with everything and worked within my budget to get what I needed. I'll be using The Peoples Market again in the future! Thank you!
Really great and friendly place. The staff is really kind. So far I have tried their coffee and soup and they're both flavorful.
Small cappuccino cup. 20 minutes after ordering we checked and they lost the order. Breakfast burrito very tasty came in paper wrap that fell apart during consumption. That turned into a mess.

I've come in a couple of times around 9:30-10am and the service has been friendly each time. The handcrafted coffee drinks have been great each time. The prices on the food seemed a little much at first but when I picked my food up at the back window, I was pleasantly surprised at the quantity and quality. Absolutely worth it!
The market is well stocked as well. I enjoy the Guyaki Yerba Mate energy drinks and they have a much wider variety of them than grocery stores and I believe a couple more than The Common Market does.

My wife is at the local hospital having a baby and she was hungry so we order from here they messed up the whole order. And then they refunded my money and tried to make it again a mess it up again and eggs in my burgers, well done, and it was actually pink. I know some people eat their food like this I do not in a pregnant woman, can I eat raw meat they miss more of two times I'm very unsatisfied
Delicious. Will return in the future. Had the chicken 'n gravy.

First time visiting but certainly not the last. Their vegan options look amazing! I went for breakfast and had the vegan chicken biscuit and hash browns. So good. The lavender vanilla latte was also delicious. Get yourself some!

Dropped in for lunch.  The food was fantastic -- got the club sandwich -- and was ready in less than 5 minutes!

Service was super helpful.  FYI, because it's not clear when you enter, you order at the counter on the left, and they will text when it is ready.

The space is clean.  Almost to the point of sterile.  The setup is more like a restaurant and not the cozy type of atmosphere you may expect of a coffee shop.

Parking across the street is convenient.

So disappointed! I'm a pescatarian and ordered a salmon wrap and ended up biting into chicken. They were not apologetic at all... they didn't even refund the tip and that was the only thing I ordered. The girl behind me said she ordered a vegan burrito and it was full of bacon. Best to check your order if you have food limitations or allergies.
Nice place to have coffee
We had a latte and a berry smoothie her both the options were delicious. They use the coffee beans from a local vendor and is also displayed on sale in the cafe. You must try the blend it's so good

I've only been here once and ordered 1 item, so I would still come back again and try something else. The item that I ordered though was okay to say the least. I had ordered a vegan buffalo wrap which had king oyster mushrooms dipped in buffalo sauce as the protein. While I love mushrooms, I don't like my wraps fully mushroom-fied. I think I was expecting the wrap to be filled with seitan or something, so this did not meet my expectations. My husband ordered a chicken buffalo wrap, and he didn't love his either.

I did see that there was a coffee shop & they also had a bagel on their menu, both of which I was eyeing. I also love that they have a bar in the middle of the restaurant. Will be back to hopefully give it a better rating!

Hands down the best vegan sausage I've ever had in my life. I don't know what they do to their meatless sausage but it just has C sooo much flavor. Definitely had an amazing breakfast bowl, the grits were also cooked really well. Came another time and had the salmon blt (no bacon) and that was amazing too. Also loved their sweet potato fries.
Everything was just on point
Joyful atmosphere in here! Chai latte was delicious

Pretty good spot with a creative menu and unique food combinations. The sriracha bacon is absolutely insane btw! They serve coffee, sandwiches, wine, pizza, bakery items, etc., and it's a very relaxed atmosphere with a good playlist running. Perfect for a quick bite, studying, or catching up with a friend. The blond lady running register was super friendly, and while the other guy working wasn't rude, I do feel like he could've increased his hospitality a bit.

The market bagel is something really incredible to start your day, the place is nice and warm. But it takes up to 20 minutes to give you a coffee to go, I also ordered it with vanilla peppermint and they didn't add it.
Besides that you eat your food without your coffee, you don't receive it with what you ask for. And in case she didn't have it, they didn't tell me either, it was easier for her not to put it, receive the money and have an unsatisfied customer.

Would have been nice to have had a drink there...I came in and sat at the bar...no one ever greeted me nor took my order. The guy next to me asked me where the bar tender was, or do we go somewhere and order? I left after 10 min.
Out of this world; delicious and so yummy lunch. We will be back when we are visiting the area!!!
This is how small business is done with big business style. Excellent!
Such a lovely place to work or spend time with friends
Fantastic neighborhood market with great eats and drinks. Perfect for dining in or on the go.
This lively little grocery/deli is an excellent option if you need to grab that last-minute dinner item, a lunch time sandwich, or that anytime-coffee, and soak up the vibes of Charlotte.

I had some extra time before a drs appt and I'm so glad I stopped in here.  The place is beautiful and the staff is amazing.  I had the vegan platter and it was the best.  Im from out of town and we don't have a lot of vegan options so to be able to have a filling breakfast was great.  Get the vegan chia latte with almond milk....GET THE VEGAN CHIA LATTE WITH ALMOND MILK!!! I'm happy I found this place and I will surely be back.
Best coffee in charlotte! Brunch options are awesome too. It's a great community space to hangout and there's weekly events like music, comedy and bartending classes to keep it fun

I was double charged for a coffee, what should be an easy fix. I went up to the counter when I noticed, but was told to wait and see if the charge came off on its own somehow. 2 days later the charge is still on my account, so I call to have it removed. They say to wait the rest of the weekend and call back. The coffee was ok, but the follow up is a bit tedious to be honest.
Good spot to meet friends or have business meetings.

Must try! Absolutely love this spot. Coffee, breakfast, lunch, dinner, drinks... they do it all and do it well. And soo many good gluten free options! Very home-y environment, easy to hang for hours. All the staff is super friendly & the owner is great! Very well run.
Local vibe that locals want. Truly a gem!
Loved my 1st visit. Breakfast burrito was yummy. I was tempted to have a breakfast beer, good local selection.
Burger is simple and delicious, the way I like it.
Went in for a quick order pick up for a friend. Atmosphere is attractive & relaxing very spacious. Customers services is exquisite.

I was excited to go here because I had been following their social media and it looked like they had delicious vegan options. We decided to go for dinner. There was not any one manning the food counter, you had to order at the coffee bar. It was nice to have vegan options, but the food could be improved a bit. My wrap was very greasy. As for the atmosphere, someone has spent a lot of time trying to make it fun coffee House vibe. It's cute, but it was so noisy that we had to eat outside because we couldn't carry on a conversation.

This was my first visit to the new location. And I still love it!  I always compare my iced caramel lattes to Not Just Coffee. In my opinion, Not Just coffee is the bar. The People's Market comes very very close to that bar. The cinnamon glazed croissant was phenomenal! Service is top notch. Plenty of seating. Great atmosphere! Plenty of pastries to choose from.
My sister and I have made this our spot .
The Mushroom Pesto pizza was amazing!
The atmosphere is everything!!!! The food is tasty!
This place is so welcoming and the food is delicious. Never disappoints. The staff is amazing too. I am a regular here.

I came here with my friend after class at CPCC because they needed to eat. However, because I already had my own food, I was planning on just dining with my own food at their table. All of sudden, this employee came up to me saying I couldn't eat and HAD to buy their own food. For a place called The People's Market, this isn't very people friendly.
Definitely too cold for this time of year. It should be heated, not cooled!
I love this place they have vegan options

I was looking for a vegan, gluten free option and this was just the place! I'm not a breakfast person but this was a great atmosphere, excellent service, and my food was wonderful! I had the Vegan Breakfast Platter and vegan apple Chai-der. The portion size lasted two meals. I highly recommend The People's Market!
Very relaxing atmosphere. Great tasting food with good portion sizes. The biscuits are unique, think they must be cornmeal or something. I enjoyed them with grape jelly. A great local breakfast spot.
I WILL NEVER ORDER FROM YOUR STORE EVER AGAIN, EVVVVERRRRRR!! THE EGGS WERE SCORCHED AND THE HASHBROWNS AND TURKEY BACON WAS UNDERCOOKED!!!!

The good hard working people at People's Market are very kind, they'll learn your name and remember it.

These folks take on the role of being the "neighborhood headquarters" very naturally, it seems the setting is very well designed to foster good interaction with employees and patrons alike.

I think it can be a challenge to pull off creating a space that can concurrently serve as a bar, and a coffee shop, and a bakery, and a restaurant.  But this place has it figured out.

I really wish People's Market the very best, I hope to see more community events (improv, game nights, singles nights, cocktail classes) in the future.

New to Charlotte and dropped into this place for the free mixology class. Ended up grabbing lunch and it was delicious! Friendly, attentive staff--perfect French fries, and an awesome atmosphere. I love that they offer everything I enjoy in one place--smoothies, coffee, wine, good food, great vibes. Will be back!!

Love visiting here.

I love the "Elizabeth" area of Charotte and really enjoy the food and drink available here.  Every one that works here are kind and very good at what they do.

Big space with live music on Sundays when I'm there.

Love sitting at the tables outside and soaking up the sun!

Thanks for being here.
We had a fantastic lunch. Fresh and delicious!

My lavender vanilla almond milk latte and GF orange cardamom donut was so good! Was waiting for my mom to get out of surgery at Novant and they were kind enough to box everything up for me to-go when I got the call that she was ready. Staff was so kind and the layout was great (although could use more outlets). Can't wait to come back and try lunch!
Great little place for some live music and a little breakfast and some coffee with friends.
I thought it was nasty but in a cool and good way. Like a nice BMX trick
10/10 best cafe in Charlotte

Way more than a coffee and smoothie bar, they have a solid menu (breakfast, lunch sandwiches, salads, pizza, and vegan options) that's full of enough choices to please everyone. I had the Chicken Avocado Wrap and it was delicious. They also have a bar with beer on tap and interesting canned beers for purchase.
The staff was very friendly and the place made me feel like I was at home. I'll definitely recommend them to all my friends

I am so glad my husband recommended this place! Justin, an employee, greeted us when we walked in & gave us all the deets.
For those that work remote, this is a perfect place to lunch. Get a Coffee
A perfect Meet up spot!
This is the coolest place! It is also Black and female owned!

The barbecue pizza he recommended was scrumptious!
I'm so glad we had a chance to visit!
I'm sure I will be back!

We tried both of their vegan donuts, impressed by both of them (one was chocolate, can't remember the second flavor but it was definitely seasonal)

My husband had their vegan breakfast plate, the patty was amazing! He really enjoyed his breakfast.
Great coffee and friendly staff. It feels like they'll have poetry any minute.
Great food, great place to work remote. They've got cool events too.
Gluten free vegan doughnuts are excellent!

The egg and cheese sandwich was reasonably priced and comes on a huge biscuit. I mean that thing was a chonkster, and I'm not mad at it. Very tasty. However, I didn't like my matcha latte. It was quite bitter (more than it's supposed to be) to the point that I wondered if it was either stored or prepared incorrectly.

Came in here at end of our night so didn't eat anything but place was nice, clean , very cozy and relaxed atmosphere.  Would return!
They have anything you could crave from coffee and cookies to mixed drink and a sandwich
Great market with excellent food, coffee and seating. We found this while staying at Novant and highly recommend the pizza, club sandwich and chicken sandwich!
Very cool atmosphere with excellent food, coffee, and drinks
There was [quiet] live music and the food was DELICIOUS. Priced well and great atmosphere. We'll be back.
Yummy coffee and food options. Love the space!
Lovely place! I ordered a smoothie and it was great! I will def come back!

Excellent experience. The space was beautifully reimagined from its prior design bringing in more contemporary elements of what we loved about The People's Market's original location, elements we loved about the former business in this location, and some new inspiration.

Pastries are baked daily, and you can even watch the pastry chef at work. The lunch counter menu has very reasonable offerings, and is ready for pickup very quickly. We loved our cheeseburger (a relatively simple double patty smashed cooked perfectly for what it was), our chicken torta (with a slightly artistic presentation but still simple and approachable), and French fries that would've come around $25, but we ran a tab and went from coffee to tea and seltzer throughout the afternoon.

Should you stay for a beer, there's an array of local taps. While there is not an excessive dried goods offering like some sundries/delis/ markets around town, there is plenty to choose. Additionally, the reach-in cooler space is full of items to enjoy on-site like alternative non-alcoholic beverages and local beers or take with you too like pasta and provisions dinners.

Easy to get in and out with street parking in addition to the parking lot across the street. Walking distance to many other shops, restaurants, and bars. One of the closest walks from Novant Health Presbyterian /Hemby Children's Hospital campus, Central Piedmont Community College. There is a CATS /LYNX gold line stop right in front of the place.
Safe to say that I would recommend.
Not very friendly or welcoming. My fries were not good. The avocado BLT was nice.
Stopped in for a drink after work with coworkers. Service was a little slow but selection was good.
Came in for coffee and a bite, which was spot on. The atmosphere here was a massive vibe
Great new find. Satisfied with my meal and service both times I visited.
really cute!!! went here for a team meeting:)
Good vibe, I like that there is an open window. Coffee quality could be better.
Great food and great service!

Came here to eat breakfast before my flight back home. Good food and good concept. There are no servers. You seat yourself , order your food and pick it up when it's ready. I thought it was cool that they also had a conference room that you can reserve. The only negative thing id have to say was the coffee took quite a while to be prepared.

Clean, open, good inside seating, only 3 bistro tables outside. A bit expensive $3.00 biscotti (no prices in view for any pastry). Biscotti was cooked with prunes...not giod. Good atmosphere for coffee and book.
The coffee was pretty good
Always great food and kind staff!
All the food is bomb! Some of the best pizza I've had in a minute. Loads of vegan options, great coffee & great prices on cocktails.
Delicious food and drink options. Comfortable open space. Awesome addition to the neighborhood!
Great spot for a multitude of uses.

The BEST breakfast in Charlotte. Amazing food. Fun ambience. Loved the live music this morning. Not too loud to carry on conversations. Highly recommend splurging and ordering a ton of stuff your first visit so you know how good everything is and can start establishing your favorites!
Happy this place is back. I do wish the blt Had more than two pieces of bacon on it.

This was me and my wife's first time visiting people's market and we loved it. We never visited the original but we are glad they are back open now and in the Elizabeth area. This location is perfect and very spacious. The iced lattes we got were great along with the food. Highly recommend visiting this place! Great atmosphere, great food and great vibes. They offer breakfast all day along with lunch food. Breakfast is my favorite food so I'm glad to see a nice variety of it. Overall, we loved it and will return back for sure.
Great neighborhood spot for breakfast & lunch with excellent coffee and a bakery
Great food and service!  So happy to have this in Elizabeth!
So glad to see People's Market come back! Everything very tasty like it was before. Definitely worth a visit.

The People's Market offers a wide variety of drinks, snacks, delicious sandwiches, southern favorites (LOVE the chicken biscuit), VEGAN options (try the vegan chicken sandwich!), which make this spot an AMAZING place to meet new or old friends since there will be something for everyone. The staff is the absolute best and the space is super inviting, cozy, and open. Super nice and relaxing atmosphere - I like the set up here even better than the Dilworth location!

So excited they're open again and in a location that's so convenient to me! Right off the Gold Line and in the heart of Elizabeth. Chicken sandwhich is to DIE for and the burger is amazing as well. I'm going to be a regular

The People's Market is truly a neighborhood hub. It features awesome foods and drinks selection, a great grab and go section, private meeting room and even a small art gallery! We ordered the breakfast chicken biscuit, berry sunshine smoothie and a vanilla latte, they were excellent! The staff is very friendly as well. Highly recommended!
Not actually open as the listing says. Had to pay parking then read the sign at the door. Do better
